sourceMeaningMnemonic: This <radical>building</radical> is full of <radical>car</radical>s because it's an <kanji>army base</kanji>. The cars (and tanks and planes) need to be ready to go at any moment just like the soldiers.
meaningInfo: Picture a giant army base housing all of the different cars the army needs at any given time.
readingMnemonic: All of the people in the <kanji>army base</kanji> are wearing <reading>jean</reading>s (<ja>じん</ja>). You thought soldiers were supposed to wear uniforms, but it looks like when they're on the base they have to wear jeans.
readingInfo: Jeans are pretty durable, now that you think about it. And if the soldiers are working on these cars in the base while they're there, it makes sense to wear a nice pair of jeans.
